cohort.reelThemIn: "Somewhere between Amazing Grace and Back in Black"
cohort.bio: Special Operations veteran turned Data Analyst from my passion of digging for answers. My favorite part about exploring data is the story that it tells and insights that it brings, all from a simple file. Data provides knowledge, and knowledge is power.

I have a background in marketing and gaming and now looking forward to landing in the field of data.
Through this course, I learned useful skills like SQL, Python, and many more tools. Also, I learned how to format my thinking process and communicate with my team members about how I'm working on my project.
I'm looking forward to utilizing what I learned in the course in the real data world!

My passion for finding novel solutions to complex technical and business issues naturally led me to the world of Analytics. Drawing on my diversified skillset, I hope to push my career to a more personally challenging level while providing value to a purpose driven team.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Framing problems as puzzles makes finding solutions more fun!"
cohort.bio: As a former business owner and math major, I already knew how impactful data could be when used strategically. Thanks to NSS, I now have the technical skills necessary to turn raw numbers into actionable insights.  Data analytics gives me the space to practice my two greatest passions: learning and problem-solving (or puzzle-solving, as I like to say). I look forward to professional opportunities that encourage me to use all of these skills while helping others.

cohort.reelThemIn: "I collected a lot of data trying to disprove observation bias. It was exactly what I expected."
"A man who knows something knows that he knows nothing at all" -Erykah Badu
"They always say that time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself." -Andy Warhol
cohort.bio: I thrive at the intersection of process improvement, stakeholder communication, & analyzing data to form actionable insights.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Culture is simply a shared way of doing something with a passion"
cohort.bio: leveraging Excel in my previous job and my background in accounting really motivated me to attend NSS(Nashville Software School) to improved my analytical skills.NSS is a great platform where you can acquire great analytical skills.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Further up and Further in" - C.S. Lewis
cohort.bio: I have spent most of my professional life in the fields of music and mathematics. In both math and music, the need to be able to think critically and analytically is a necessity. As I have also worked as a teacher in both fields, I have also developed the ability to communicate ideas to others well and to check for understanding. More recently, I became aware of the field of Data Analytics and was interested the potential of blending analytical skills and communication skills to solve real world problems. In addition, I have a passion for utilizing my skills to help others unlock and leverage the ever growing world of data. In the NSS Data analytics bootcamp, I have developed a good foundation of the skills required to do just that and I am very excited to keep learning and growing in this field.

cohort.reelThemIn: "If we have data, let's look at data.  If all we have are opinions, let's go with mine." - Jim Barksdale
"Data is the language of the powerholders."
"Data is a precious thing and will last longer than the systems themselves."
cohort.bio: With constant thought of numbers, Data Analytics has given me the power not just to transform data but to tell a story with numbers.

cohort.reelThemIn: "If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough." - Albert Einstein
cohort.bio: My entire career has evolved through using data to build solutions to problems. Data analytics is the next step in that evolution.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Never theorize before you have data.  Invariably, you end up twisting facts to suit theories, instead of theories to suit facts."
cohort.bio: Through my experiences as a Business and Financial Analyst I was exposed to Data Analysis. I love how data can be leveraged to provide insight as to how to understand and improve nearly anything. This passion drew me to continue developing my skills in Data and Business Analytics.

cohort.reelThemIn: "If somebody tortures the data enough (open or not), it will confess anything." - Paolo Magrassi
cohort.bio: Data has been in a part of my career before I knew it was what I wanted to do as a career. In the last year and a half, I took a hard look at my future and decided to make some decisions. In this look at my past, I decided to look at my past work and see what drew me in and if there were any common factors. After much thought and reflection data seemed to just scream out at me. I have worked in data entry, manipulation, and collection. In this realization I began my exploration into this field and the exciting opportunities available. This led me to Nashville Software School.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Everbody's scared, but if you don't let your fears stop you, that's bravery." - Leslie Feinberg
cohort.bio: In my background in project management, I focused on coordinating a team to create high quality products that met our clients marketing needs and helped them reach their goals. From there, I decided to change paths. Because of my interest in problem solving and data, I enrolled in Nashville Software School, where I'm learning the essential tools of data analysis. I'm driven by exceeding the expectations of the client through transforming messy, raw data into relevant, useful insights that will help them, and therefore my team, be successful.

My higher education in the social sciences introduced me to the power of quantitative data analysis in understanding social problems. To further my knowledge, I joined Nashville Software School's Data Analytics Bootcamp and have developed an intensive technical background in data analytics tools and the practical experience of collaborating with teams to inform organizational outcomes. I bring an empathy-driven perspective along with strong written/oral communication skills and deep technical skills to wherever I work.

cohort.reelThemIn: "A jack of all trades is a master of none but still always better than a master of none"
